guide.title: AMD64 2005.0 Upgrade Guide
guide.abstract: This guide will show you how to upgrade from 2004.3 and 2004.3 with lib64 to 2005.0

chapter.title: Howto Upgrade an AMD64 installation from 2004.3 to 2005.0.

body.p: Multilib is now required for the 2005.0 profile. If you wish to have a pure-64bit system, you can use the 2005.0/no-multilib profile. Information on switching to that profile will be provided soon. This guide will show you how to upgrade a prior installation to a system that uses our new profile and the new multilib. There are two ways of upgrading: the easy and scripted way, or the longer way by hand.

body.pre: # mkdir /usr/tmp/profile-update # cd /usr/tmp/profile-update # wget http://amd64.gentoo.org/Makefile-profile_update-2005.0 # lynx -source http://amd64.gentoo.org/Makefile-profile_update-2005.0.md5sum | md5sum -c - If you use a PORTDIR other than /usr/portage, please edit the PORTDIR variable in the Makefile. # make -f Makefile-profile_update-2005.0 # emerge -upv system # emerge -uv system

body.p: If you currently have USE=-multilib, you need to set multilib in USE and re-emerge gcc.
body.pre:
# nano /etc/make.conf remove -mutilib from USE flags
# emerge gcc If youu get an error about not having a multilib sandbox, you need to set FEATURES=-sandbox # FEATURES=-sandbox emerge gcc
body.p: Additionally, you need to make sure you have the required versions of toolchain/portage packages to take full advantage of multilib.
body.pre: # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-apps/portage-2.0.51-r9' # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-devel/gcc-config-1.3.9' # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-devel/distcc-2.18.3-r1' # emerge unmerge linux26-headers # emerge -v --oneshot '>=linux-headers-2.6.8.1-r4'
body.p: Next, make sure our 32bit glibc version is up to date. This version is needed to bootstrap building the 32bit glibc after the profile switch. After that happens, we remove the emul-* ones from our system.
2005.0 doesn't use symlinks from /lib32 and /usr/lib32 to the emul directories, so we need to change them into directories and copy over some important files.
body.pre: # rm /lib32 /usr/lib32 # mkdir /lib32 /usr/lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/lib32/libsandbox.so /lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/usr/lib32/libc.so /usr/lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/usr/lib32/libpthread.so /usr/lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/usr/lib32/*crt*.o /usr/lib32 # env-update
body.p: Now, we need to make sure our baselayout is up to date, so we can gurantee /etc/env.d/04multilib exists.
We are now ready to actually switch the profile to 2005.0
Now just build glibc, unmerge the emul-* ones and update the base system.
body.pre: # emerge -v --oneshot glibc # emerge unmerge emul-linux-x86-glibc # emerge -upv system # emerge -uv system
